page.title: 01The Cilcain/Pantymwyn Area
page.content: This area, around the villages of Cilcain and Pantymwyn, straddles the upper valley of the River Alyn to the west of the town of Mold. The area is predominantly pastoral farmland, but the river and streams, woods and the higher ground of the Clwydian Hills rising to the west give the landscape a scenic quality, which has long attracted ramblers and nature-lovers. Many educational visits to the area are also made both by local schools and by groups staying at the nearby Colomendy Environmental Studies Centre. The major local industries are agriculture and limestone quarrying, but many residents commute to work outside the immediate vicinity. Both the villages have expanded with the construction of new housing, and support an active social life.
